phrases.text: Qua bức kỳ anh đi chơi phố
phrases.english: Across the embankment, I went to town

culturalContext.description: Journey across the river embankment to town
facts: Embankments (bức kỳ) are common features along Vietnamese rivers
Going to town was a special occasion in rural life

phrases.text: anh thấy cô nữ ăn mặc lịch sự
phrases.english: I saw a young lady dressed elegantly

culturalContext.description: First sight of the elegant lady
facts: Elegant dress was a sign of refinement and social status
The compound 'ăn mặc lịch sự' describes refined appearance
culturalContext.musicalContext: Introduction of the main subject - the beautiful woman

phrases.english: and my heart grew more fond

facts: Vietnamese love songs often describe gradual emotional development
The heart (lòng) is the seat of emotions in Vietnamese culture
culturalContext.musicalContext: Emotional response to seeing the beautiful woman

phrases.text: Cả đầu treo đeo giải yếm điều
phrases.english: From her hair hung decorative bodice ribbons

facts: Yếm is a traditional Vietnamese bodice/halter top
Decorative ribbons were signs of beauty and femininity
culturalContext.musicalContext: Detailed description of the woman's traditional attire begins

phrases.text: cái bộ xà tích mà em đeo
phrases.english: the silver jewelry set that you wear

facts: Xà tích refers to silver jewelry, highly valued in traditional Vietnamese culture
Jewelry indicated wealth and social status

phrases.text: Dây lưng điều khăn mỏ quạ
phrases.english: Decorative belt and crow's beak kerchief

facts: Khăn mỏ quạ (crow's beak kerchief) is a traditional style of headwear
Decorative belts were important fashion elements
culturalContext.musicalContext: Detailed catalog of traditional clothing items

phrases.text: dây lưng cánh trả vành vạnh mà hoa tai
phrases.english: belt with butterfly clasps and round earrings

facts: Butterfly-shaped clasps were popular decorative elements
Earrings (hoa tai - literally 'ear flowers') were essential jewelry
culturalContext.musicalContext: Continuing the detailed description of adornments

phrases.text: Áo bán giàng mà lại vá vai

culturalContext.description: Traditional shirt style with embroidered details
facts: Áo bán giàng is a semi-formal traditional shirt
Shoulder embroidery added elegance and decoration
Ivory was a precious material indicating wealth
Ivory jewelry sets were treasured possessions

phrases.english: your phoenix eyes gaze at whom

facts: Phoenix eyes (mắt phượng) are considered ideal beauty in Vietnamese culture
Upturned, almond-shaped eyes are highly praised
culturalContext.musicalContext: Shift from clothing to facial features

phrases.english: your phoenix eyes glance at whom

culturalContext.description: Poetic repetition emphasizing the captivating gaze
facts: Liếc (sidelong glance) suggests coyness and flirtation
Repetition creates musical and emotional emphasis
culturalContext.musicalContext: Musical variation on the previous phrase

phrases.text: lúng la lúng lính như ngôi sao mai
phrases.english: twinkling and sparkling like the morning star

culturalContext.description: Poetic simile comparing eyes to morning star
facts: The morning star (Venus) symbolizes beauty and brightness
Lúng la lúng lính are onomatopoetic words suggesting sparkling
culturalContext.musicalContext: Closing phrase with poetic imagery and melodic wordplay

patterns.theme: Admiration of a beautiful woman's traditional attire and features
